title: Table 1: % Children enrolled in different types of schools. By age group and sex. 2024
description: Enrollment statistics for children in Tamil Nadu for the year 2024. The table provides a percentage breakdown of students enrolled in Government, Private, and Other schools, as well as those not currently in school. Data is categorized by age groups (6-14, 7-16, 7-10, 11-14, 15-16) and sex (Boys, Girls, All).
data: | Age group and sex | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in school | Total |

title: Table 2: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2022
description: Data on the enrollment distribution of children aged 3 to 8 years in Tamil Nadu for 2022. The table shows the percentage of children attending various pre-school institutions (Anganwadi, Government pre-primary, Private LKG/UKG) and schools (Government, Private, Other), as well as those not in any school.
data: | Age | Pre-school | Pre-school | Pre-school | School | School | School | Not in pre-school or school | Total |
| Age | Angan-wadi | Govt pre-primary | Pvt LKG/UKG | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in pre-school or school | Total |

title: Table 3: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2024
description: Detailed enrollment statistics for children aged 3 to 8 years in Tamil Nadu for 2024. This table covers participation rates in pre-schooling (Anganwadi, Govt pre-primary, Private LKG/UKG) and formal schooling (Government, Private, Other), including the percentage of out-of-school children.
data: | Age | Pre-school | Pre-school | Pre-school | School | School | School | Not in pre-school or school | Total |
| Age | Angan-wadi | Govt pre-primary | Pvt LKG/ UKG | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in pre-school or school | Total |

title: Table 4: % Children by grade and reading level. All children. 2024
description: Reading proficiency assessment results for children in grades I through VIII in Tamil Nadu (2024). The table categorizes students by their highest reading level: 'Not even letter', 'Letter', 'Word', 'Std I level text', or 'Std II level text'.
data: | Std | Not even letter | Letter | Word | Std I level text | Std II level text | Total |

title: Table 5: Trends over time
description: Historical trends (2014-2024) in reading outcomes for Standard III children in Tamil Nadu. The table tracks the percentage of students capable of reading Standard II level text, with a breakdown by school type (Government vs. Private).
data: | Year | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text |

title: Table 6: Trends over time
description: Trends in advanced reading skills for students in Standard V and Standard VIII in Tamil Nadu (2014-2024). Data displays the percentage of children who can read Standard II level text, categorized by Government and Private schooling.
data: | Year | % Children in Std V who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std V who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std V who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text |
| Year | Govt | Pvt | Govt & Pvt* | Govt | Pvt | Govt & Pvt* | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text |

title: Table 7: % Children by grade and arithmetic level. All children. 2024
description: Arithmetic proficiency data for students in grades I-VIII in Tamil Nadu for 2024. The table categorizes children by their highest arithmetic ability, including number recognition, subtraction, and division.

title: Table 8: Trends over time
description: Longitudinal analysis (2014-2024) of basic arithmetic skills for Standard III students in Tamil Nadu. The table tracks the percentage of children capable of performing subtraction, comparing Government and Private schools.
data: | Year | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction |

title: Table 9: Trends over time
description: Historical data on division-level arithmetic proficiency for Standard V and Standard VIII students in Tamil Nadu (2014-2024). The table compares the performance of students in Government versus Private schools.
data: | Year | % Children in Std V who can do division | % Children in Std V who can do division | % Children in Std V who can do division | % Children in Std VIII who can do division | % Children in Std VIII who can do division | % Children in Std VIII who can do division |
| Year | Govt | Pvt | Govt & Pvt* | Govt | Pvt | Govt & Pvt* |

title: Table 10: Smartphone availability and use. By age. 2024
description: Survey data on smartphone accessibility and usage for adolescents (ages 14-16) in Tamil Nadu for 2024. Metrics include home availability, ability to use smartphones for digital tasks, general usage, and personal ownership.
data: | Age | % Children who: | % Children who: | % Children who: | Of those who can use a smartphone, % who have their own smartphone |
| Age | Have a smart-phone at home | Could bring a smartphone to do digital tasks* | Can use a smartphone | Of those who can use a smartphone, % who have their own smartphone |

title: Table 11: Smartphone availability and use among 14-16-year-olds. By sex. 2024
description: Gender-disaggregated data on smartphone availability and use for 14-16 year olds in Tamil Nadu (2024). The table compares Boys and Girls on home access, ability to perform digital tasks, usage rates, and smartphone ownership.
data: | Sex | % Children who: | % Children who: | % Children who: | Of those who can use a smartphone, % who have their own smartphone |
| Sex | Have a smartphone at home | Could bring a smartphone to do digital tasks* | Can use a smart-phone | Of those who can use a smartphone, % who have their own smartphone |

title: Table 12: Of those who know how to use a smartphone, % children who used a smartphone in the reference week for any educational activity and social media activity, and know how to use safety features. By age. 2024
description: Digital literacy and online safety statistics for smartphone-using children (ages 14-16) in Tamil Nadu (2024). The table covers participation in educational activities vs. social media, and knowledge of safety features like blocking profiles, making profiles private, and changing passwords.

title: Table 15: Trends over time
description: Information on the sample size of the school survey in Tamil Nadu, detailing the number of Primary and Upper Primary schools visited in 2010, 2018, 2022, and 2024.

title: Table 16: Trends over time
description: Attendance trends for children and teachers in Tamil Nadu schools across the years 2010, 2018, 2022, and 2024, showing the average percentage of enrolled staff and students present on the day of the visit.

title: Table 17: Trends over time
description: Trends in school facility or enrollment characteristics in Tamil Nadu from 2010 to 2024. The data likely indicates the percentage of schools meeting specific criteria (e.g., small schools or specific infrastructure status) over time.

title: Table 18: Multigrade classes. 2024
description: Statistics on multigrade classroom practices in Tamil Nadu for 2024, showing the percentage of schools where children in Standard I and Standard II were observed sitting with students from other grades.
data: | % Schools | Std I children  observed sitting with any other Std | Std II children  observed sitting with any other Std |

title: Table 19: Observation of TLM (Teaching Learning Materials) in classrooms. 2024
description: Classroom observation data for 2024 regarding the availability and use of Teaching Learning Materials (TLM) in Tamil Nadu schools. It tracks whether TLM was observed in Std I and II classrooms and if student work was displayed.
data: | % Schools | TLM observed in classroom (apart from textbooks) | TLM observed in classroom (apart from textbooks) | Of those schools with TLM, work done by students displayed in classroom | Of those schools with TLM, work done by students displayed in classroom |
| % Schools | Std I | Std II | Std I | Std II |

title: Table 20: Trends over time
description: Comprehensive trends in school infrastructure and Right to Education (RTE) indicators in Tamil Nadu (2010-2024). The table covers the availability and condition of mid-day meals, drinking water, toilets (including separate girls' toilets), libraries, electricity, and computers.
data: | Mid-day meal | Mid-day meal served in school on the day of visit | 99.4 | 98.7 | 99.6 | 99.2 |
| Mid-day meal | Kitchen/shed for cooking mid-day meal | 96.7 | 96.2 | 95.0 | 96.6 |
| Drinking water | No facility for drinking water | 12.8 | 9.7 | 9.2 | 14.4 |
| Drinking water | Facility but no drinking water available | 6.7 | 10.1 | 8.8 | 7.9 |
| Toilet | Facility but toilet not useable | 48.5 | 9.0 | 16.0 | 16.0 |
| Girls' toilet | No separate provision for girls' toilet | 20.8 | 3.9 | 5.9 | 8.0 |
| Girls' toilet | Separate provision but locked | 23.0 | 3.9 | 6.3 | 3.0 |
| Girls' toilet | Separate provision, unlocked but not useable | 21.0 | 6.0 | 9.3 | 11.6 |
| Girls' toilet | Separate provision, unlocked and useable | 35.1 | 86.2 | 78.6 | 77.5 |
| Library | Library but no books being used by children on the day of visit | 21.3 | 31.4 | 25.5 | 22.4 |
| Library | Library books being used by children on the day of visit | 57.8 | 52.4 | 54.5 | 64.3 |
| Electricity | Of schools with electricity connection, % schools with electricity available on the day of visit |  | 94.5 | 96.0 | 96.9 |
| Computer | No computer available for children to use | 53.0 | 42.1 | 56.7 | 41.3 |
| Computer | Computer available but not being used by children on the day of visit | 17.6 | 28.6 | 23.8 | 30.2 |
| Computer | Computer being used by children on the day of visit | 29.4 | 29.3 | 19.4 | 28.5 |

title: Table 21: Foundational Literacy and Numeracy (FLN) activities. 2024
description: Status of Foundational Literacy and Numeracy (FLN) implementation in Tamil Nadu schools for 2023-2024 and 2024-2025. The table includes data on government directives, teacher training (offline/online), availability of FLN materials, and School Readiness Programmes.
